TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class TextReader : MarshalByRefObject, IDisposable
.class public auto ansi abstract serializable beforefieldinit TextReader extends System.MarshalByRefObject implements class System.IDisposable
Public MustInherit Class TextReader Inherits MarshalByRefObject Implements IDisposable
public ref class TextReader abstract : MarshalByRefObject, IDisposable
type TextReader = class inherit MarshalByRefObject interface IDisposable

summary.span: Represents a reader that can read a sequential series of characters.

span.span: Represents a reader that can read a sequential series of characters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是 和 的抽象基类，分别从流和字符串读取字符。 is the abstract base class of and , which read characters from streams and strings, respectively. 使用这些派生类打开文本文件以读取指定范围内的字符，或创建基于现有流的读取器。Use these derived classes to open a text file for reading a specified range of characters, or to create a reader based on an existing stream. > [!IMPORTANT] > 此类型实现 接口。This type implements the interface. 当你完成使用从此类型派生的任何类型时，应直接或间接释放它。When you have finished using any type that derives from this type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接释放类型，请在 `try`/ 块中调用其 `catch` 方法。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要间接释放类型，请使用 `using`（在 C# 中）或 `Using`（在 Visual Basic 中）等语言构造。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 有关详细信息，请参阅 接口主题中的 Dispose 和 "使用实现 IDisposable 的对象" 一节。For more information, see Dispose and the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. ## Examples 类是抽象类。The class is an abstract class. 因此，不要在代码中对其进行实例化。Therefore, you do not instantiate it in your code. 类派生自 ，并提供成员的实现以从流中读取。The class derives from and provides implementations of the members for reading from a stream. 下面的示例演示如何使用 方法读取文件中的所有字符。The following example shows how to read all the characters in a file by using the method. 它在将字符添加到 类的实例之前，检查每个字符是否为字母、数字或空格。It checks whether each character is a letter, digit, or white space before adding the character to an instance of the class. [!code-csharp[System.IO.StreamReader#42](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.StreamReader/CS/example42.cs#42)] [!code-vb[System.IO.StreamReader#42](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.StreamReader/VB/example42.vb#42)]

para.span: 派生类必须至少实现 和 方法才能 提供有用的实例。

span.span: A derived class must minimally implement the and methods to make a useful instance of .

summary.span: Closes the and releases any system resources associated with the .

span.span: Closes the and releases any system resources associated with the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此实现 `Close` 调用 方法并向其传递一个 `true` 值。This implementation of `Close` calls the method and passes it a `true` value. > [!NOTE] > 在派生类中，不要重写 方法。In derived classes, do not override the method. 相反，重写 方法，以添加用于释放资源的代码。Instead, override the method to add code for releasing resources.

summary.span: Releases all resources used by the object.

span.span: Releases all resources used by the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在完成使用 后，应调用 。Call when you are finished using the . 方法使 处于不可用状态。The method leaves the in an unusable state. 调用 后，必须释放对 的所有引用，以便垃圾回收器可以回收 占用的内存。After calling , you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying. 有关详细信息，请参阅[清理非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)和[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). > [!NOTE] > 每次释放对 的最后一个引用前，均应调用 。Always call before you release your last reference to the . 否则，在垃圾回收器调用 对象的 方法之前，该对象正在使用的资源不会被释放。Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's method.

summary.span: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.

span.span: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法由 public `Dispose` 方法和 方法调用。This method is called by the public `Dispose` method and the method. 默认情况下，此方法将 `disposing` 参数指定为 `true`。By default, this method specifies the `disposing` parameter as `true`. 将 `disposing` 参数指定为 `false`。 specifies the `disposing` parameter as `false`. 当 `disposing` 参数为 `true` 时，此方法释放该 引用的、由任何托管对象持有的全部资源。When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. 此方法调用每个引用对象的 `Dispose` 方法。This method invokes the `Dispose` method of each referenced object.

para.span: 可以由其他对象多次调用。

span.span: can be called multiple times by other objects.

para.span: 重写此方法时，请注意不要引用先前在中调用 的对象。

span.span: When overriding this method, be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to .

para.span: 有关如何实现此方法的详细信息，请参阅[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。

span.span: For more information about how to implement this method, see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).

para.span: 有关 和 的详细信息，请参阅[清理非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 从 文本读取器读取类似于从流的末尾读取：Reading from the text reader is similar to reading from the end of a stream: - 和 方法返回-1。The and methods return -1. - 方法返回零。The method returns zero. - 方法将返回 `null`。The method returns `null`. - 方法返回空字符串。The method returns an empty string.

span.span: Reads the next character without changing the state of the reader or the character source.

summary.span: Returns the next available character without actually reading it from the reader.

span.span: Returns the next available character without actually reading it from the reader.

returns.span: An integer representing the next character to be read, or -1 if no more characters are available or the reader does not support seeking.

span.span: An integer representing the next character to be read, or -1 if no more characters are available or the reader does not support seeking.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法返回一个整数值，以确定文件的末尾或发生了其他错误。The method returns an integer value in order to determine whether the end of the file, or another error has occurred. 这允许用户首先检查返回值是否为-1，然后再将其强制转换为 类型。This allows a user to first check if the returned value is -1 before casting it to a type. 此操作不会更改 的当前位置。The current position of the is not changed by this operation. 如果没有更多可用字符，则返回的值为-1。The returned value is -1 if no more characters are available. 默认实现将返回 -1。The default implementation returns -1. 类是抽象类。The class is an abstract class. 因此，不要在代码中对其进行实例化。Therefore, you do not instantiate it in your code. 有关使用 方法的示例，请参阅 方法。For an example of using the method, see the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 基础文本读取器的位置由读入到 `buffer`中的字符数来提前。The position of the underlying text reader is advanced by the number of characters that were read into `buffer`. 方法会一直阻止，直到读取 `count` 字符或读取了所有字符。The method blocks until either `count` characters are read, or all characters have been read. 这是 的阻塞版本。This is a blocking version of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 直到读取 `count` 参数指定的字符数或已到达文本的末尾后，任务才会完成。The task does not complete until either the number of characters specified by the `count` parameter are read, or the end of the text has been reached.

Public Overridable Function ReadLine () As String
public: virtual System::String ^ ReadLine();
abstract member ReadLine : unit -> string override this.ReadLine : unit -> string

summary.span: Reads a line of characters from the text reader and returns the data as a string.

span.span: Reads a line of characters from the text reader and returns the data as a string.

returns.span: The next line from the reader, or if all characters have been read.

span.span: The next line from the reader, or if all characters have been read.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 行定义为字符序列，后跟回车符（0x000d）、换行符（0x000a）、回车符、换行符、换行符、或流结束标记。A line is defined as a sequence of characters followed by a carriage return (0x000d), a line feed (0x000a), a carriage return followed by a line feed, , or the end-of-stream marker. 返回的字符串不包含终止回车符或换行符。The string that is returned does not contain the terminating carriage return or line feed. 如果到达了输入流的末尾，则返回值为 `null`。The return value is `null` if the end of the input stream has been reached. 如果方法引发 异常，则读取器在基础 中的位置将由该方法可以读取的字符数提前，但已读入内部 缓冲区的字符将被丢弃。If the method throws an exception, the reader's position in the underlying is advanced by the number of characters the method was able to read, but the characters that were already read into the internal buffer are discarded. 由于无法更改流中读取器的位置，已读取的字符不可恢复，只能通过重新初始化 对象来访问。Because the position of the reader in the stream cannot be changed, the characters that were already read are unrecoverable and can be accessed only by reinitializing the object. 如果流中的初始位置未知或流不支持查找，则还需要重新初始化基础 。If the initial position within the stream is unknown or the stream does not support seeking, the underlying also needs to be reinitialized. 若要避免这种情况并生成可靠的代码，应使用 方法，并在预分配的缓冲区中存储读取字符。To avoid such a situation and produce robust code you should use the method and store the read characters in a preallocated buffer. 类是抽象类。The class is an abstract class. 因此，不要在代码中对其进行实例化。Therefore, you do not instantiate it in your code. 有关使用 方法的示例，请参阅 方法。For an example of using the method, see the method.

span.span: An I/O error occurs.

span.span: There is insufficient memory to allocate a buffer for the returned string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类是抽象类。The class is an abstract class. 因此，不要在代码中对其进行实例化。Therefore, you do not instantiate it in your code. 有关使用 方法的示例，请参阅 方法。For an example of using the method, see the method. 如果当前 表示 属性返回的标准输入流，则 方法同步执行，而不是以异步方式执行。If the current represents the standard input stream returned by the property, the method executes synchronously rather than asynchronously.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果方法引发 异常，则读取器在基础 中的位置将由该方法可以读取的字符数提前，但已读入内部 缓冲区的字符将被丢弃。If the method throws an exception, the reader's position in the underlying is advanced by the number of characters the method was able to read, but the characters that were already read into the internal buffer are discarded. 由于无法更改流中读取器的位置，已读取的字符不可恢复，只能通过重新初始化 来访问。Because the position of the reader in the stream cannot be changed, the characters that were already read are unrecoverable and can be accessed only by reinitializing the . 如果流中的初始位置未知或流不支持查找，则还需要重新初始化基础 。If the initial position within the stream is unknown or the stream does not support seeking, the underlying also needs to be reinitialized. 若要避免这种情况并生成可靠的代码，应使用 方法，并在预分配的缓冲区中存储读取字符。To avoid such a situation and produce robust code you should use the method and store the read characters in a preallocated buffer. 类是抽象类。The class is an abstract class. 因此，不要在代码中对其进行实例化。Therefore, you do not instantiate it in your code. 有关使用 方法的示例，请参阅 方法。For an example of using the method, see the method.
